alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Lapeer; Shiawassee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 5:58PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...ANOTHER ROUND OF OF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT SHIAWASSEE...GENESEE...AND LAPEER COUNTIES DURING THE EVENING COMMUTE... HAZARDS...Areas of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to near a quarter of a mile. Temperatures at or below freezing also allow additional accumulation on untreated roads. A quick additional inch of accumulation on unpaved surfaces. The larger area of activity brings a 1 to 2 hour period of intermittent heavy snow bursts to the region and more directly affects the I-69 corridor. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 557 PM EST, areas of heavy snow were along a line from near St. Charles to Henderson to near Morrice and moving east at 35 MPH. THIS AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Durand and Byron around 610 PM EST. New Lothrop and Gaines around 615 PM EST. Flushing, Swartz Creek, Linden and Montrose around 625 PM EST. Flint and Fenton around 630 PM EST. Clio, Mount Morris, Lake Fenton and Beecher around 635 PM EST. Grand Blanc and Crossroads Village around 640 PM EST. Lapeer around 650 PM EST. This includes the following highways... I-75 between mile markers 106 and 133. I-475 between mile markers 1 and 16. I-69 between mile markers 98 and 172. US-23 between mile markers 78 and 90. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution when traveling into or through areas of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
